titleStmt.title: Thomas Edwards to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG0984

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Apprehension of Fugitives from Justice Papers, 1863-1867

body.p:
To
Commonwealth of Kentucky
Mercer County -- Sct --
To His Excellency, Thomas E. Bramlette,
Govenor of Kentucky;

Your Petitioner, Mercer County Judge, Thos- Edwards, represents that the following persons have committed a heinous offence against the person of Mrs- Gray by committing a rape upon her person in the presence of her husband whom they had bound and robbed, You are therefore especially petitioned, requested, and implored by me to offer a reward of $500 each for said parties, whose names are Thomas Jenkins, Anthony Smith and John Bishop -- The description of them is herewith presented as part hereof --
5 Sept 1865
Thos Edwards P J M C C
